result.execSummary:
The defendant Mitchell T Picord was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Straight time if imposed.
Sentence credit of 38 days was granted, if revoked.
Consecutive to: Present sentence

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied.  Costs paid in full.  Balance refunded to poster.

Participate in Alumni Group.
  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
  Maintain full time employment and/or school combination.
  Provide DNA Sample if not yet already previously obtained. 
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: To be performed as a condition of probation.

Waukesha County DTC Diversion Contract
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Mitchell T Picord in court, in custody, with attorney Eric R. Hart.   Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count1_. Court accepts plea as, knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily made. Court withholds entry of judgment as the defendant has been accepted into DTC. Court approves the Waukesha County DTC Diversion Contract and forwards the file to DTC.  Count #1 is dismissed and read in.
Plea hearing on May 23, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Mitchell T Picord in court, in custody, with attorney Eric R. Hart.   Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Hart advises the Court the Defendant is still on the DTC wait list and requests a date towards the end of May.  The Court schedules the matter for a plea in late May.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 23, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on April 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mitchell T Picord in court, in custody, with attorney Eric R. Hart.   Stephen Joseph Centinario appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant was accepted and on the wait list for treatment court.  There are about 15 people on the wait list.  Hearing scheduled for April 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Hearing at 03-17-2016 08:30 am

Defendant Mitchell T Picord in court, in custody, with attorney Eric R. Hart.   Stephen Joseph Centinario appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Hart requests an adjournment of the trial and advises the Court the Defendant has applied to Drug Treatment Court.  The Defendant is currently on a probation hold on a Milwaukee County case. Attorney Hart requests a date be set in 30 days to review status of application.  The Defendant is sworn in by the clerk and the Defendant waives his right to a jury trial.  The Court adjourns the trial and sets the matter out 30 days to check on status of treatment court.  Hearing scheduled for March 17, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Filed by the State. Witness list attached.
Jury trial - 12 person at 02-23-2016 08:15 am
Jury status hearing at 02-18-2016 09:30 am

Defendant Mitchell T Picord in court, in custody, with attorney Eric Richard Hart.   David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Attorney Hart advises the Court that they are no long taking parties for the Drug Treatment Court until February.    The Defendant is being sentenced on a Milwaukee County Case and Attorney Hart requests that the Court consider delaying disposition until February.  The Defendant has also obtained new charges waiting a preliminary hearing.   The Court sets the matter for trial.  Jury status hearing scheduled for February 18, 2016 at 09:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for February 23, 2016 at 08:15 am.
